question: 人数
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>person</kanji> <kanji>count</kanji> is <vocabulary>the number of people</vocabulary>. Don't confuse this with the "population" or something like that, though. This is more like "how many people are at this event?" What's the <ja>人数</ja>, you know?
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Note that rendaku turns <ja>すう</ja> into <ja>ずう</ja>, and since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Do you know <vocabulary>the number of people</vocabulary> at <reading>Nin</reading>tendo (<ja>にん</ja>)? It's a big mystery, which is why they hired you to count every single one of them. Good luck!
